column4: I have a question regarding Ubuntu backports... Does Breezy come with backports already enabled?
there is no dvd decrypter for Linux :(
does Breezy come with backports already enabled?
no, but as of colony 5 they are in the sources.list
the three menus at the top are more or less the same thing

I understand kgpg is built for KDE... *but* I think I understand anything made for KDE could still work on GNOME and without much problem *or* is it simlpe recommended I get the GNOME support version?
it even minimizes to the notification area (system tray)
in order to select your entire home folder minus one you need to list all the other folders in the tar command
on the command line I would have to list all 40 folders - the one I don't want?
yeah... you see why command line is better ;)
It's for windows but it should work on linux, just change the paths.
I think you hit it right on the head!
I found that ugly globe... am going to murder it now...
